ActionConnection.description: Specific type for an action connection.

supportedActions.description: If you want to provide a different set of available actions to a specific connection then you can do so here.

type.description:
The actions connection type allows connections to execute a list of actions that the platform will carry out e.g.
show-home

AppEndpointOptions.description: Application endpoint which can be a string, or a mapping.

contexts.description:
Required. A comma separated list of the types of contexts the intent offered by the application can process,
where the first part of the context type is the namespace e.g."fdc3.contact, org.companyname.contact"

customConfig.description: Custom configuration for the intent that may be required for a particular desktop agent.

displayName.description: An optional display name for the intent that may be used in UI instead of the name.

resultType.description:
An optional type for output returned by the application, if any, when resolving this intent. May indicate a
context type by type name (e.g. "fdc3.instrument"), a channel (e.g. "channel") or a combination that indicates a
channel that returns a particular context type (e.g. "channel<fdc3.instrument>").

appChannels.description: Describes the application's use of App Channels.

broadcasts.description: Context type names that are broadcast by the application on the channel.

description.description: A description of how the channel is used.

listensFor.description: Context type names that the application listens for on the channel.

name.description: The name of the App Channel.

intents.description: Describes the app's interactions with intents.

listensFor.description:
A mapping of Intents names that an app listens for via fdc3.addIntentListener() or
fin.me.interop.registerIntentHandler. Used to support intent resolution by the interop broker. Replaces the
intents array used previously.

raises.description:
A mapping of Intent names that an app raises (via fdc3.raiseIntent) to an array of context type names that it
may be raised with. Use the intent name "any" to represent use of the fdc3.raiseIntentForContext and
fdc3.findIntentForContext functions, which allow the user to select from intents available for a specified
context type.

userChannels.description: Describes the application's use of context types on User Channels.

broadcasts.description: Context type names that are broadcast by the application.

listensFor.description: Context type names that the application listens for.

AppProviderOptions.description: App Provider settings to configure where apps are fetched from.

appsSourceUrl.description:
Legacy - Where should we fetch the apps from. It is a url or an array of urls from which to get apps data from.
If present it will be used instead of endpointIds.

cacheDurationInMinutes.description:
Once all apps are fetched and processed from the one or more sources specified, how long should the result be
cached for in minutes (can be used with the seconds setting).

cacheDurationInSeconds.description:
Once all apps are fetched and processed from the one or more sources specified, how long should the result be
cached for in seconds (can be used on it's own or in addition to the minutes setting).

endpointIds.description:
An array of endpoints that should be used to request a list of apps. The array entry can be a string
(representing the array id) or an object with an inputId that maps to an endpoint id and gets passed to the
endpoint specified using the outputId (this is useful for mapping apps from one format to another)

includeCredentialOnSourceRequest.description: Legacy - Used when appsSourceUrl is used. This is specified as part of the options of the fetch request.

manifestTypes.description:
The specified app sources may include apps of many different manifest types. Which manifest types do you want
your platform to support (only the ones listed will be included in the end result).

AppSourceConnection.description: Specific type for an app source connection.

manifestTypes.description:
If a connection is allowed to provide apps do you wish to limit the manifest types they can provide you with. The
connection type must be supported if it is an app entry where the selection should go back to the connection.

type.description:
The appSource connection type allows connections to provide a list of apps that can show up in home and the
store. Apps with manifest type id connection will be send back to the connection on selection (e.g. a child view)

anyOf.description:
Represents the arrangement of Views within a Platform window's Layout.  We do not recommend trying
to build Layouts or LayoutItems by hand and instead use calls such as {@link Platform#getSnapshot getSnapshot} or our
{@link https://openfin.github.io/golden-prototype/config-gen Layout Config Generation Tool}..

AutoplayPolicyOptions.description:
Autoplay policy to apply to content in the window, can be
`no-user-gesture-required`, `user-gesture-required`,
`document-user-activation-required`. Defaults to `no-user-gesture-required`.

BootstrapComponents.description: The components that can be bootstrapped.

autoShow.description:
Which components should auto show after the bootstrapping process. As home vanishes on blur we suggest adding
home last if you wish it to show.

autostartApps.description:
Should the platform launch one or more apps at the end of the bootstrapping process if they have declared
autostart as true in their metadata? Default behavior is true.

dock.description: Should the platform register against the dock component?

home.description: Should the platform register against the home component?

notifications.description: Should the platform register itself against the notification center and have a platform specific tab show up?

store.description: Should the platform register against the store component?

BrokerConnection.description: Specific type for a broker connection.

type.description: The broker connection type allows connections to connect to our broker in order to react to context sharing.

BrowserButtonType.description: Types of buttons on browser windows

BrowserProviderOptions.description: Browser Provider Options includes the default window/page and view options.

defaultPageOptions.description: Default options when creating a new page. If `iconUrl`, `unsavedIconUrl`, `panels` or `closeButton` are not defined when creating a page, setting will default to `defaultPageOptions`.

defaultViewOptions.description: The default options when creating a new browser window. Any option not included in WorkspacePlatform.getCurrentSync().Browser.createView(options) call will default to the value provided in this field.

defaultWindowOptions.description: Default options for creating a new browser window. Any option not included in WorkspacePlatform.getCurrentSync().Browser.createWindow(options) call will default to the value provided in this field.

globalMenu.description: This setting lets you customize the default workspace browser main menu and specify your own.

menuOptions.description: This setting lets you configure options related to the menus shown in the browser.

includeDefaults.description:
Should the workspace default options be included or do you want to be specific about what should show in the
menu.

globalMenu.description: Should we include all the default options for the global menu? Default is true.

pageMenu.description: Should we include all the default options for the page menu? Default is true.

viewMenu.description: Should we include all the default options for the view menu? Default is true.

pageMenu.description: This setting lets you customize the page right click context menu and add your own entries.

toolbarButtons.description: This setting lets you override the default workspace browser buttons and specify your own.

viewMenu.description: This setting lets you customize the view right click context menu and add your own entries.

windowOptions.description:
deprecated use `defaultWindowOptions` instead to specify settings that will apply to all workspace browser
windows

CascadingWindowOffsetStrategy.description: The cascading window strategy for positioning new windows.

maxIncrements.description: The maximum number increment, before resetting to start, defaults to 8.

x.description: The x offset to increment by for each new window, defaults to 30.

y.description: The y offset to increment by for each new window, defaults to 30.

connectionTypes.description: An array of the connection types this connection will be permitted to use.

identity.description:
The identity uuid of the incoming connection or * as a wildcard. We currently do not restrict down to the name
level so it can be blank or omitted.

validatePayload.description: Should we check the payload be validated for this connection when it connects.

connectionId.description:
The channel id that external apps will use to connect to this platform (it will be prefixed with your platform's
uuid e.g. your-uuid-connection-id)

connectionValidationEndpoint.description:
If you want to validate the payload passed by connecting apps you can specify the endpoint id that should receive
the payload and return whether or not it is valid.

connections.description:
An array of connections that this platform allows being connected from. By specifying * as the uuid you can allow
any connection and give it certain capabilities. You can then specify specific uuids with more capabilities.

supportedActions.description:
The connection provider can have actions registered against it from the platform. This provides a default list of
actions that connections should be able to use if actions are enabled for that connection.

ContentCreationRule<ContentCreationBehav.description:
A rule for creating content in OpenFin; maps a content type to the way in which
newly-opened content of that type will be handled.

behavior.description: Behavior to use when opening matched content.

match.description:
List of [match patterns](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) that indicate the specified
behavior should be used

options.description: Options for newly-created view or window (if applicable).

CustomActionSpecifier.description: Configures a custom action when the control is invoked

customData.description: Any data necessary for the functioning of specified custom action

id.description: Identifier of a custom action defined at platform initialization

CustomActionSpecifier_1.description: Configures a custom action when the control is invoked

customData.description: Any data necessary for the functioning of specified custom action

id.description: Identifier of a custom action defined at platform initialization

action.description: Custom action once the button is clicked

disabled.description: Disable custom button true or false

tooltip.description: Button name text when hovered over

type.description: Type of cutom browser button

CustomSettings.description: The custom settings section defined in the manifest.

DockButtonAction.description: A button which launched an app or action.

action.description: If an appId isn't provided then provide details related to the action

customData.description: data that should be passed to the action

id.description: The id of the action to fire

appId.description: Should this action launch a specific app (the icon and tooltip will be pulled from the app if possible)

iconUrl.description: The icon to use to distinguish this entry from others

tooltip.description: The tooltip to be shown for this button/entry

DockButtonApp.description: A single app or a list of apps

display.description: Should this entry show a single app or a group of apps.

iconUrl.description: The icon to use to distinguish this entry from others

tags.description:
The tags to use to find the single app or a collection of apps that need to be listed. This will be compared
against the tags associated with apps returned from the app data sources.

tooltip.description: The tooltip to be shown for this button/entry

DockButtonDropdown.description: Button type which shows a drop down.

iconUrl.description: The icon to use to distinguish this entry from others

tooltip.description: The tooltip to be shown for this button/entry

apps.description: What apps should be made available via the dock

buttons.description: What custom actions should be made available via the dock

icon.description: The icon to show in the dock component

id.description: The id to use when registering against the dock component

title.description: The title for your dock registration

workspaceComponents.description: Which workspace related icons should be hidden from the dock

endpoints.description:
An array of endpoint definitions that can either use the built in fetch support or load modules that provide
different implementations for executing actions or performing request/response actions

id.description:
A unique id for this endpoint. This ID will be called by the platform. In the future you may change what the
implementation for this endpoint is but you can keep the same endpoint id and request/response objects in order
to not require changes from the platform.

options.description: The data to be passed to this endpoint when it is called so that it knows how to act

type.description: This uses the built in support for fetch and the options will be the fetch options

body.description: The body to send with the fetch.

credentials.description: Credentials to send with the fetch.

headers.description: Additional headers to send with the fetch.

GlobalContextMenuOptionType.description:
Types of global context menu options, including pre-defined ones.
User-defined context menu items should use the value `Custom`

commandCode.description: A keycode that can be used to interact with this Search Provider.

description.description: A short description of the Search Provider.

hidden.description: A flag to indicate this provider will not be displayed as a command.

icon.description: An icon that a UI can display for the Search Provider.

id.description: A unique ID used to identify the search provider.

inputPlaceholder.description: The placeholder string to be displayed in a UI when targeting this specific Search Provider.

listTitle.description: A title to display above the result list in a UI when targeting this specific Search Provider.

logoUrl.description: Logo to show render when targeting this specific Search Provider.

queryAgainst.description:
What do you wish to run the query against when filtering apps. An array of entries. If not specified it will
default to ["title"]. Since we store the app definition inside of a cli search result's data field you can add
data.tags to the array so that it will see if the query matches the start of a tag e.g. ["title","data.tags"]

queryMinLength.description: How many characters need to be entered before filtering the available apps

scoreOrder.description: The order to sort the score in. The default is `ascending`.

sourceFilter.description: Options for the source filters displayed in home.

disabled.description: Should we disable the source filters, defaults to false.

label.description: The label to display in home, defaults to Source.

title.description: A UI friendly title for the search provider.

autoStart.description: Does the integration start automatically if enabled (default is true).

excludeFromSourceFilter.description:
If this property is set then the module will not show in the source filter
and its results will always be included.

moduleUrl.description: This is the old property, it will be remapped to url.

url.description: The url to load the module from.

command.description: What command should we look for in order to return the list of integrations

commandDescription.description: What description should accompany the command

icon.description: An icon representing the top level integration provider

integrations.description: This is the old module list name, remove in future.

isManagementEnabled.description: Do you wish to expose an option of turning on/off integrations.

intentTimeout.description:
How long should the broker wait after launching a view/window for it to register an intent handler. The default
is 5000 (5 seconds)

fdc3InteropApi.description: the fdc3 api version this picker will support (default is v2)

height.description: the height you wish the window to be

title.description: A suggested title for the intent picker/resolver ui

url.description: The url of the html page that has the intent picker

width.description: the width you wish the window to be

content.description: Array of configurations for items that will be created as children of this item.

type.description: The type of the item. Possible values are 'row', 'column', 'stack', and 'component'.

content.description: Array of configurations for items that will be created as children of this item.

type.description: The type of the item. Possible values are 'row', 'column', 'stack', and 'component'.

content.description: Array of configurations for items that will be created as children of this item.

type.description: The type of the item. Possible values are 'row', 'column', 'stack', and 'component'.

ManifestTypeId.description: Manifest types used in manifest files.

MaximumVersion.description: Information about the version of the platform and it's dependencies

MenuEntry.T.description:
Types of global context menu options, including pre-defined ones.
User-defined context menu items should use the value `Custom`

MenuEntry.T_1.description:
Types of page tab context menu options, including pre-defined ones.
User-defined context menu items should use the value `Custom`

MenuEntry.T_2.description: View tab context menu types for {@link WorkspacePlatformProvider.openViewTabContextMenu} override.

checked.description: Should only be specified for `checkbox` type menu items.

conditions.description: If the menu entry is included are there additional conditions that determine whether or not it should be shown (e.g. only show the logout menu entry if the authenticated condition is true)

data.description: Data related to the menu option

enabled.description: If false, the menu item will be greyed out and unclickable.

icon.description: Image Data URI with image dimensions inferred from the encoded string

include.description: Should this menu entry definition be included in the list of menu entries

position.description: Where should this menu item be positioned in relation to existing entries

separator.description: Should a menu separator be added

submenu.description:
Should be specified for `submenu` type menu items. If `submenu` is specified,
the `type: 'submenu'` can be omitted.

type.description:
Can be `normal`, `separator`, `submenu`, or `checkbox`.
Defaults to 'normal' unless a 'submenu' key exists

visible.description: If false, the menu item will be entirely hidden.

checked.description: Should only be specified for `checkbox` type menu items.

conditions.description: If the menu entry is included are there additional conditions that determine whether or not it should be shown (e.g. only show the logout menu entry if the authenticated condition is true)

data.description: Data related to the menu option

enabled.description: If false, the menu item will be greyed out and unclickable.

icon.description: Image Data URI with image dimensions inferred from the encoded string

include.description: Should this menu entry definition be included in the list of menu entries

position.description: Where should this menu item be positioned in relation to existing entries

separator.description: Should a menu separator be added

submenu.description:
Should be specified for `submenu` type menu items. If `submenu` is specified,
the `type: 'submenu'` can be omitted.

type.description:
Can be `normal`, `separator`, `submenu`, or `checkbox`.
Defaults to 'normal' unless a 'submenu' key exists

visible.description: If false, the menu item will be entirely hidden.

checked.description: Should only be specified for `checkbox` type menu items.

conditions.description: If the menu entry is included are there additional conditions that determine whether or not it should be shown (e.g. only show the logout menu entry if the authenticated condition is true)

data.description: Data related to the menu option

enabled.description: If false, the menu item will be greyed out and unclickable.

icon.description: Image Data URI with image dimensions inferred from the encoded string

include.description: Should this menu entry definition be included in the list of menu entries

position.description: Where should this menu item be positioned in relation to existing entries

separator.description: Should a menu separator be added

submenu.description:
Should be specified for `submenu` type menu items. If `submenu` is specified,
the `type: 'submenu'` can be omitted.

type.description:
Can be `normal`, `separator`, `submenu`, or `checkbox`.
Defaults to 'normal' unless a 'submenu' key exists

visible.description: If false, the menu item will be entirely hidden.

checked.description: Should only be specified for `checkbox` type menu items.

data.description: Data to be returned if the user selects the element. Must be serializable

enabled.description: If false, the menu item will be greyed out and unclickable.

icon.description: Image Data URI with image dimensions inferred from the encoded string

submenu.description:
Should be specified for `submenu` type menu items. If `submenu` is specified,
the `type: 'submenu'` can be omitted.

type.description:
Can be `normal`, `separator`, `submenu`, or `checkbox`.
Defaults to 'normal' unless a 'submenu' key exists

visible.description: If false, the menu item will be entirely hidden.

MenuPosition.description: The position for a menu entry.

customId.description: If position type is Custom then a customId is required in order to do lookups of this entry in the list of entries

operation.description: What should we do with this menu option

type.description: The type of Menu entry this is

MenuPosition.T.description:
Types of global context menu options, including pre-defined ones.
User-defined context menu items should use the value `Custom`

MenuPosition.T_1.description:
Types of page tab context menu options, including pre-defined ones.
User-defined context menu items should use the value `Custom`

MenuPosition.T_2.description: View tab context menu types for {@link WorkspacePlatformProvider.openViewTabContextMenu} override.

MenuPositionOperation.description: Operations that can be performed on menus when they are being updated.

MenuPosition_1.description: The position for a menu entry.

customId.description: If position type is Custom then a customId is required in order to do lookups of this entry in the list of entries

operation.description: What should we do with this menu option

type.description: The type of Menu entry this is

MenuPosition_2.description: The position for a menu entry.

customId.description: If position type is Custom then a customId is required in order to do lookups of this entry in the list of entries

operation.description: What should we do with this menu option

type.description: The type of Menu entry this is

MenuSeparatorPosition.description: Position for adding separators during update operations.

MinimumVersion.description: Information about the version of the platform and it's dependencies

ModuleDefinition<unknown>.description: The definition of a module with generic data for options.

url.description: The url to load the module from.

id.description:
A unique id for this endpoint. This ID will be called by the platform. In the future you may change what the
implementation for this endpoint is but you can keep the same endpoint id and request/response objects in order
to not require changes from the platform.

options.description: The data to be passed to this endpoint when it is called so that it knows how to act

type.description: This indicates that this endpoint depends on a module that needs to be loaded in order for it to work

typeId.description: The id of the module that should be loaded.

ModuleList.description:
Auth Provider Options. Specify a single auth module if your application requires authentication before allowing the
user to use the platform.

ModuleList_1.description:
InitOptions Provider Options. This is a list of modules that will be loaded and used to handle init params (similar
to query strings). The module data setting needs to specify "supportedActions" and this should be an array of strings
of the actions this module supports. The init params used must specify action (which would map onto the action
supported) by your module and optionally payload if your module supports being passed a payload (this should be a
base64 encoded object when passed via init params).

ModuleList_2.description:
Logger Provider Options - A list of modules that will act as loggers that can receive logging information sent by the
platform

ModuleList_3.description: A list of modules that provide actions that can be used by the platform.

ModuleList_4.description:
A list of modules that provide a set of conditions. The function for this condition will return true or false to
indicate if the condition is met. Conditions are used in a number of places (for example menu options)

ModuleList_5.description:
This is a list of modules that allow you to hook into the lifecycle events exposed by the platform. A good example
might be you wish to register a module that is called when an authenticated session is expired

ModuleList_6.description:
A list of modules that will be loaded and then called when analytical events come in from the platform or workspace
components.

ModuleList_7.description: A list of modules that provide menu for different locations.

NotificationProviderOptions.description: Notification Provider Options. Providing settings in order to register your platform against the notification center.

icon.description: URL of the icon to be displayed for this platform.

scheme.description: This is the scheme associated with this platform.

title.description:
Stream title.

Providing a different displayName for an existing stream id will update the
displayName of the stream stored in Notification Center.

workspacePlatform.description: Workspace platform that registers this platform

action.description: If an appId isn't provided then provide details related to the action

customData.description: data that should be passed to the action

id.description: The id of the action to fire

appId.description: Should this action launch a specific app (the icon and tooltip will be pulled from the app if possible)

tooltip.description: The tooltip to be shown for this button/entry

closeButton.description:
Used to manipulate behaviour of a close button on a page tab. If `undefined`, then close button is visible and actionable.
If either property true, this page tab's context menu will disable its 'Close Page' option.

description.description: An optional UI friendly description of the page.

iconUrl.description: Icon that appears on a page tab if there are no unsaved changes. If 'undefined', default icon will appear.

isLocked.description: True if the page is locked.

isReadOnly.description: True if the page is read only. In this state, the page is locked and cannot be unlocked.

pageId.description: The unique ID of the page.

panels.description: Used to configure fixed views on the edges of the browser window. Only one panel per side is supported.

title.description: A UI friendly title for the page.

tooltip.description: A optional UI friendly tooltip for the page.

unsavedIconUrl.description: Icon that appears on a page tab if there are unsaved changes (dirty state). If 'undefined', default icon will appear.

settings.description: Represents a potential ways to customize behavior of your Layout

machineId.description: The id of the machine that created the page.

machineName.description: The name of the machine that created the page.

PageTabContextMenuOptionType.description:
Types of page tab context menu options, including pre-defined ones.
User-defined context menu items should use the value `Custom`

height.description: Size of the top/bottom panel, formatted as CSS property value with units. E.g. "0px", "10%", "3rem".

position.description: Position of the panel in the page.

viewOptions.description: The options with which to initialize the panel view.

extendToBottom.description:
When true, the left/right panel extends all the way to the bottom of the window,
thus taking priority over the bottom panel.

extendToTop.description:
When true, the left/right panel extends all the way to the top of the window,
thus taking priority over the top panel.

position.description: Position of the panel in the page.

viewOptions.description: The options with which to initialize the panel view.

width.description: Size of the left/right panel, formatted as CSS property value with units. E.g. "0px", "10%", "3rem".

PlatformApp.description: Definition for application with extended properties.

autostart.description:
Does the application wish to be automatically started when the platform
is initialized. Default behavior is false

customConfig.description:
An optional set of name value pairs that can be used to deliver custom
data from an App Directory to a launcher.

description.description: UI friendly description for an application.

icons.description: A list of icons that can be rendered in UI for this application.

images.description: A list of optional images that highlight application functionality.

instanceMode.description:
This only applies to web views/windows. Default is multi instance. Should
we aim to only launch one instance of this application and only show the
app even if the intent resolver ui supports instances of apps. If multi
should we support multiple instances and let the user decide whether to
launch a new instance or pick an existing one from the intent picker? If
new it means the intent picker will not show the option to pick an
instance because the app owner wants a new instance every time. And if an
intent is raised and just the id of the app is specified it will always
launch a new instance

interop.description:
Metadata that describes how the application uses FDC3/Interop APIs. This
metadata serves multiple purposes:
- It supports intent resolution by an OpenFin Platform/ interop agent, by
declaring what intents an app listens for.
- It may be used, for example in an app catalog UI, to find apps that
'interoperate with' other apps.
- It provides a standard location to document how the app interacts with
user channels, app channels, and intents, for use by other app
developers and desktop assemblers.

manifest.description: The different types of content that can be contained in the manifest.

manifestType.description:
Describes the type of manifest resolved by the `manifest` field.
Launch mechanics are determined by the manifest type.

moreInfo.description: Optional URL that provides more information about the application

name.description:
Name is provided for support for fdc3 mappings if not provided then appId
is used as name. Internally we use appId

private.description:
This indicates that an entry in the directory is something that shouldn't
be displayed in a UI (e.g. store, dock, home) but can be launched via an
API (from an fdc3, interop api, function or intent picker (as this UI was
driven by an API))

title.description: A UI friendly title for the application.

tooltip.description: Optional tooltip description e.g. for a launcher or dock component

anyOf.description: Platform custom theme with options using extended types.
Platform custom theme with options and scheme using extended types.

PlatformCustomTheme.description: Platform custom theme either with or without options.

PlatformCustomThemeOptions.description: Platform custom theme with options using extended types.

default.description:
If you are specifying a single palette in your theme and it is a light palette then you can indicate that by
specifying the default of light (otherwise we will assume it is dark) If you specify palettes and have a light
and a dark palette then this setting specifies a default preference (it defaults to picking the dark palette if a
default is not specified)

iconFolder.description:
If there is a shared folder across themes that have light and dark icons you can specify a folder name to use
instead of the theme id (or label if there is no id)

id.description: An id to help identify this theme as labels can change over time and are used for display

PlatformCustomThemeOptionsWithScheme.description: Platform custom theme with options and scheme using extended types.

default.description:
If you are specifying a single palette in your theme and it is a light palette then you can indicate that by
specifying the default of light (otherwise we will assume it is dark) If you specify palettes and have a light
and a dark palette then this setting specifies a default preference (it defaults to picking the dark palette if a
default is not specified)

iconFolder.description:
If there is a shared folder across themes that have light and dark icons you can specify a folder name to use
instead of the theme id (or label if there is no id)

id.description: An id to help identify this theme as labels can change over time and are used for display

PlatformInteropBrokerOptions.description: Options for the platform interop broker.

intentOptions.description: Options related to the way this platform supports intents

intentResolver.description:
Intent Resolver configuration if you wish to support intents. It needs to support the functions required by the
platform

unregisteredApp.description:
If an unregistered app is included here then it indicates you wish to support selecting views/windows that are
not linked to an app from an intent picker that supports instances. The intents and contexts in this app specify
which you support for unregistered instances. Do not specify a manifest or manifestType for this entry (we don't
launch unregistered apps so there is no need for a manifest as it is existing instances and we specify a custom
manifestType for consideration when we are bringing an unregistered web app instance into focus).

initUrl.description:
This is optional and only needed if you are using shell mode where you wish to load a small module with just auth
logic first followed by a module with the rest of the platform core. Specify the entry point here. We do generate
the provider bundle and provide an example in our docs.

intentPicker.description:
Intent Picker is being removed in a future version. Please use interop.intentResolver for the resolver/picker
settings

interop.description: interop settings related to this platform

rootUrl.description: What is the root url of you platform e.g. https://mydomain.com

sharing.description:
Do you want to enable this platforms sharing capability (you will still need to have 2 endpoints called
share-save and share-get for the storing and retrieval of the share target)

tooltip.description: Button name text when hovered over

type.description: Type of default browser button

PrebuiltContextMenuItem.description: Context menu item with an implementation provided by OpenFin.

ScoreOrder.description: The order to sort scored search results in.

ShowViewOnWindowResizeOptions.description: _Platform Windows Only_. Enables views to be shown when a Platform Window is being resized by the user.

SnapshotSourceConnection.description: Specific type for a snapshot source connection.

type.description: The snapshotSource connection type allows connections to be accepted as a snapshot source

action.description: Custom action once the button is clicked

disabled.description: Disable custom button true or false

links.description: A set of links to display on Storefront's footer.

logo.description: A logo to be displayed on the Storefront's footer.

StorefrontLink.description: Represents a link to be rendered inside Storefront.

title.description: A UI friendly title to render the link as.

url.description: When the rendered `title` text is clicked, the user will be navigated to this URL.

footer.description: The configuration of the footer for the store

icon.description: The icon to be displayed in the store drop down

id.description: The id you wish to use when you register the store component

bottomRow.description: The bottom row of the landing page

hero.description: Configuration for the hero section of the store if you wish one.

cta.description: Configuration for the Call To Action button of the hero section

description.description: The body description of the hero section

title.description: The title of the Hero section

middleRow.description: The middle row of the landing page

tags.description: The tags to use as a source of apps. The store will take the first x number of apps until the row is full.

title.description: The title for the middle row

topRow.description: Configuration for the top row of the landing page (just below the hero section if it is configured)

id.description:
This should be an idempotent and unique ID (think GUID) that doesn't change for this navigation section
regardless of how many times it is regenerated (e.g. e.g. more items can be added or the title changed but
the ID stays the same). As you navigate around the store this ID is used as a route. So if a user clicks on a
link, navigates to a new page and the re-requested navigation section has a different ID then the store will
not be able to find a match and it won't be able to render the navigation items.

items.description: The items to list when the user navigates to that section of the store

title.description: The title to show in the navigation

primaryButton.description: The action triggered when the primary button is clicked, defaults to launching the app.

secondaryButtons.description: Secondary buttons added to all store entries.

title.description: The title for the store which will show up in the store dropdown

StorefrontSettingsLandingPageRow.description: Landing page row containing title and items.

items.description: The items in the row.

id.description:
This should be an idempotent and unique ID (think GUID) that doesn't change for this navigation item regardless
of how many times it is regenerated (e.g. e.g. more items can be added or the title changed but the ID stays the
same). As you navigate around the store this ID is used as a route. So if a user clicks on a link, navigates to a
new page and the re-requested navigation item has a different ID then the store will not be able to find a match
and it won't be able to render the navigation item.

tags.description:
The Storefront API has a collection of apps for a navigation item. Tags is an approach for how you can determine
what apps should be included in a navigation item. i.e we filter the apps list by one or more tags and assign
those apps to the navigation item.

title.description: The title for the navigation item

id.description:
This should be an idempotent and unique ID (think GUID) that doesn't change for this navigation item regardless
of how many times it is regenerated (e.g. e.g. more items can be added or the title changed but the ID stays the
same). As you navigate around the store this ID is used as a route. So if a user clicks on a link, navigates to a
new page and the re-requested navigation item has a different ID then the store will not be able to find a match
and it won't be able to render the navigation item.

tags.description:
The Storefront API has a collection of apps for a navigation item. Tags is an approach for how you can determine
what apps should be included in a navigation item. i.e we filter the apps list by one or more tags and assign
those apps to the navigation item.

title.description: The title for the navigation item

edge.description: Which edge of a monitor the taskbar is on

cssVarPrefix.description: If providing the palette through css variables would you like a specific custom prefix?

schemaNames.description:
If providing a class at the root document for content providers to indicate light/dark would you like to provide
something other than the default.

themes.description: The Themes you wish your platform to support

anyOf.description: Configuration Object for the show/hide tabs button within the browser toolbar
Configuration Object for the page lock/unlock button within the browser toolbar

ToolbarButton.description: Buttons on the left of WindowStateButtonOptions

VersionInfo.description: Information about the version of the platform and it's dependencies

app.description: The version of the the instance of this platform if provided

notificationCenter.description: The version of the notification center that this platform instance has connected to

platformClient.description: The version of the code of this platform

runtime.description: The version of the runtime this platform instance is running against

rvm.description: The version of the rvm that was used to launch this platform

workspace.description: The version of the workspace components this platform is currently connected to

workspaceClient.description: The version of the workspace client code

workspacePlatformClient.description: The version of the workspace platform client code

VersionProviderOptions.description: Settings related to the configuration of the version provider.

appVersion.description: The version of the the instance of this platform

endpointId.description:
If you specify an endpoint then you are telling the platform to send information to this endpoint. The
information sent will be the VersionRequest object. If you provide minimumVersion and maximumVersion information
in the settings then the platform will use those to calculate what has failed validation (minimum and/or maximum)
and pass those onto the endpoint.

The endpoint then returns an object with status (this returns the version info you sent, the min/max rules and
what has failed. The failures indicate the state of the platform.). If the status indicates that things need to
be managed and should not proceed they will have a windowOptions property. This should be launched and that
window will be built to support what should happen next.
- Should the window tell the user that the setup isn't compatible and offer to shut down the platform?
- Should it try to close the platform and launch a compatible manifest?
- Should it notify the user that a newer version of the app is available and that they should restart? On the
initial request while the platform is running an invalid status will result in the bootstrapping stopping.

maxVersion.description:
You can specify if the platform should stop initializing if the version is more than any of the specified maximum
versions

minVersion.description:
You can specify if the platform should stop initializing if the version is less than any of the specified minimum
versions

versionCheckIntervalInSeconds.description:
If an endpoint is specified and an interval is specified then you want the platform to call this endpoint on an
interval to see if an update of your application is available.

versionWindow.description:
This window will be shown if an endpointId is not specified and min and max criteria has been specified and has
not been met. This window will be shown to the user and the bootstrapping process will be stopped.

accelerator.description: Enable keyboard shortcuts for devtools, zoom, reload, and reload ignoring cache.

autoplayPolicy.description:
Autoplay policy to apply to content in the window, can be
`no-user-gesture-required`, `user-gesture-required`,
`document-user-activation-required`. Defaults to `no-user-gesture-required`.

backgroundColor.description:
The views _backfill_ color as a hexadecimal value. Not to be confused with the content background color
(`document.body.style.backgroundColor`),
this color briefly fills a views (a) content area before its content is loaded as well as (b) newly exposed
areas when growing a view. Setting
this value to the anticipated content background color can help improve user experience.
Default is white.

bounds.description: Initial bounds given relative to the window.

contentCreation.description: Configures how new content (e,g, from `window.open` or a link) is opened.

contentNavigation.description:
Restrict navigation to URLs that match a whitelisted pattern.
In the lack of a whitelist, navigation to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

contextMenuOptions.description: Configure the context menu when right-clicking on a window.

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._

customRequestHeaders.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the view.

items.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the window.

headers.description:
Headers for requests sent by window; {key: value} results
in a header of `key=value`.

items.description:
Object representing headers and their values, where the
object key is the name of header and value key is the value of the header

urlPatterns.description: The URL patterns for which the headers will be applied.

hotkeys.description:
Defines the hotkeys that will be emitted as a `hotkey` event on the view. For usage example see [example]{@tutorial hotkeys}.
Within Platform, OpenFin also implements a set of pre-defined actions called
[keyboard commands]{@link https://developers.openfin.co/docs/platform-api#section-5-3-using-keyboard-commands}
that can be assigned to a specific hotkey in the platform manifest.

items.description: A hotkey binding.

keys.description: The key combination of the hotkey, i.e. "Ctrl+T".

manifestUrl.description:
**Platforms Only.** Url to a manifest that contains View Options. Properties other than manifestUrl can still be used
but the properties in the manifest will take precedence if there is any collision.

preloadScripts.description: Scripts that run before page load.  When omitted, inherits from the parent application.

items.description: A script that is run before page load.

url.description: The URL from which the script was loaded.

processAffinity.description: String tag that attempts to group like-tagged renderers together. Will only be used if pages are on the same origin.

target.description: The identity of the window this view should be attached to.

ViewTabMenuOptionType.description: View tab context menu types for {@link WorkspacePlatformProvider.openViewTabContextMenu} override.

WindowCreationOptions.description:
Options required to create a new window with {@link Window.create Window.create}.

Note that `name` is the only required property  albeit the `url` property is usually provided as well
(defaults to `"about:blank"` when omitted).

accelerator.description: Enable keyboard shortcuts for devtools, zoom, reload, and reload ignoring cache.

alphaMask.description:
Turns anything of matching RGB value transparent.

Caveats:
* runtime key --disable-gpu is required. Note: Unclear behavior on remote Desktop support
* User cannot click-through transparent regions
* Not supported on Mac
* Windows Aero must be enabled
* Won't make visual sense on Pixel-pushed environments such as Citrix
* Not supported on rounded corner windows

autoShow.description: Automatically show the window when it is created.

autoplayPolicy.description:
Autoplay policy to apply to content in the window, can be
`no-user-gesture-required`, `user-gesture-required`,
`document-user-activation-required`. Defaults to `no-user-gesture-required`.

backgroundColor.description:
The windows _backfill_ color as a hexadecimal value. Not to be confused with the content background color
(`document.body.style.backgroundColor`),
this color briefly fills a windows (a) content area before its content is loaded as well as (b) newly exposed
areas when growing a window. Setting
this value to the anticipated content background color can help improve user experience.
Default is white.

contentCreation.description: Configures how new content (e,g, from `window.open` or a link) is opened.

contentNavigation.description:
Restrict navigation to URLs that match a whitelisted pattern.
In the lack of a whitelist, navigation to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

contentRedirect.description:
Restrict redirects to URLs that match a whitelisted pattern.
In the lack of a whitelist, redirects to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

contextMenuOptions.description: Configure the context menu when right-clicking on a window.

cornerRounding.description:
Defines and applies rounded corners for a frameless window. **NOTE:** On macOS corner is not ellipse but circle rounded by the
 average of _height_ and _width_.

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._

customRequestHeaders.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the window.

items.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the window.

headers.description:
Headers for requests sent by window; {key: value} results
in a header of `key=value`.

items.description:
Object representing headers and their values, where the
object key is the name of header and value key is the value of the header

urlPatterns.description: The URL patterns for which the headers will be applied.

defaultCentered.description:
Centers the window in the primary monitor. This option overrides `defaultLeft` and `defaultTop`. When `saveWindowState` is `true`,
this value will be ignored for subsequent launches in favor of the cached value. **NOTE:** On macOS _defaultCenter_ is
somewhat above center vertically.

hotkeys.description:
Defines the hotkeys that will be emitted as a `hotkey` event on the window. For usage example see [example]{@tutorial hotkeys}.
Within Platform, OpenFin also implements a set of pre-defined actions called
[keyboard commands]{@link https://developers.openfin.co/docs/platform-api#section-5-3-using-keyboard-commands}
that can be assigned to a specific hotkey in the platform manifest.

items.description: A hotkey binding.

keys.description: The key combination of the hotkey, i.e. "Ctrl+T".

icon.description:
A URL for the icon to be shown in the window title bar and the taskbar.
When omitted, inherits from the parent application._
 note: Window OS caches taskbar icons, therefore an icon change might only be visible after the cache is removed or the uuid is changed.

ignoreSavedWindowState.description:
Ignores the cached state of the window.
Defaults the opposite value of `saveWindowState` to maintain backwards compatibility.

modalParentIdentity.description: Parent identity of a modal window. It will create a modal child window when this option is set.

preloadScripts.description: Scripts that run before page load.  When omitted, inherits from the parent application.

items.description: A script that is run before page load.

url.description: The URL from which the script was loaded.

processAffinity.description: String tag that attempts to group like-tagged renderers together. Will only be used if pages are on the same origin.

resizeRegion.description: Defines a region in pixels that will respond to user mouse interaction for resizing a frameless window.

taskbarIconGroup.description:
Specify a taskbar group for the window.
_If omitted, defaults to app's uuid (`fin.Application.getCurrentSync().identity.uuid`)._

viewVisibility.description: _Platform Windows Only_. Controls behavior for showing views when they are being resized by the user.

WindowStateButton.description: Buttons to the top far right of Browser

WorkspacePlatformToolbarButton.description: Toolbar button with can be visibility options.

conditions.description: If the button is included should there be conditions related to whether or not it is shown (e.g. authenticated)

id.description: A unique id for your button

include.description: Should this definition be included in the list of buttons

* Not supported on Mac

taskbarIconGroup.description:
Specify a taskbar group for the window.
_If omitted, defaults to app's uuid (`fin.Application.getCurrentSync().identity.uuid`)._

viewVisibility.description: _Platform Windows Only_. Controls behavior for showing views when they are being resized by the user.

workspacePlatform.description: WorkspacePlatform specific window options. These options will not work unless a workspace platform has been initialized.

disableMultiplePages.description:
Remove the Page UI and only allow a single page in the browser window.
Must be set to true for this behavior.  If this is not set to false,
then an empty `pages` option will be populated with a single page.

favicon.description: The favicon to display on the top left of the created browser window.

isLocked.description:
When true, disables the ability to close pages, drag pages within the window,
and drag pages into/out of the window. False by default.

newPageUrl.description:
Landing page that shows up when you add a new page from the plus button that exists in the window frame where the page selector is shown.
If you do not provide a newPageUrl, then the new Page plus button will not be shown and you cannot create a new empty Page or Window.

newTabUrl.description:
Landing page that shows up when you add a new tab from the plus button that exists in the tabstrip.
If you do not provide a newTabUrl, then the plus button in the tabstrip will not be shown and users cannot create a new empty tab.

pages.description: The initial set of pages to add to the created browser window.

preventPageClose.description: When true, disables the ability to close pages in the window. False by default.

preventPageDrag.description:
When true, page tabs in the window will not be draggable.
This includes reordering pages and dragging them out of the window.
False by default.

preventPageDragIn.description: When true, disables the ability to drag pages into the window. False by default.

preventPageDragOut.description: When true, disables the ability to drag pages out of a window. False by default.

title.description: A UI friendly title for the created browser window.

__type_1.description:
Represents the arrangement of Views within a Platform window's Layout.  We do not recommend trying
to build Layouts or LayoutItems by hand and instead use calls such as {@link Platform#getSnapshot getSnapshot} or our
{@link https://openfin.github.io/golden-prototype/config-gen Layout Config Generation Tool}..

content.description: Array of configurations for items that will be created as children of this item.

type.description: The type of the item. Possible values are 'row', 'column', 'stack', and 'component'.

__type_10.description: Defines a region in pixels that will respond to user mouse interaction for resizing a frameless window.

sides.description: Enables resizing interaction for each side of the window.

currentContextGroup.description: Context Group for the client. (green, yellow, red, etc.).

providerId.description: When provided, automatically connects the client to the specified provider uuid.

devtools.description:
If `true`, enables the devtools keyboard shortcut:
`Ctrl` + `Shift` + `I` _(Toggles Devtools)_

reload.description:
If `true`, enables the reload keyboard shortcuts:
`Ctrl` + `R` _(Windows)_
`F5` _(Windows)_
`Command` + `R` _(Mac)_

reloadIgnoringCache.description:
If `true`, enables the reload-from-source keyboard shortcuts:
`Ctrl` + `Shift` + `R` _(Windows)_
`Shift` + `F5` _(Windows)_
`Command` + `Shift` + `R` _(Mac)_

zoom.description:
NOTE: It is not recommended to set this value to true for Windows in Platforms as that may lead to unexpected visual shifts in layout. If `true`, enables the zoom keyboard shortcuts:
`Ctrl` + `+` _(Zoom In)_
`Ctrl` + `Shift` + `+` _(Zoom In)_
`Ctrl` + `NumPad+` _(Zoom In)_
`Ctrl` + `-` _(Zoom Out)_
`Ctrl` + `Shift` + `-` _(Zoom Out)_
`Ctrl` + `NumPad-` _(Zoom Out)_
`Ctrl` + `Scroll` _(Zoom In & Out)_
`Ctrl` + `0` _(Restore to 100%)_

iframe.description: Configure injection of OpenFin API into iframes based on domain

crossOriginInjection.description: Inject OpenFin API into cross-origin iframes

sameOriginInjection.description: Inject OpenFin API into same-origin iframes

In the lack of a whitelist, navigation to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

showViewsOnSplitterDrag.description: Allows views to be shown when they are resized by the user dragging the splitter between layout stacks.

showViewsOnTabDrag.description: _Supported on Windows Operating Systems only_. Allows views to be shown when the user is dragging a tab around a layout.

showViewsOnWindowResize.description: Enables views to be shown when a Platform Window is being resized by the user.

Defines the hotkeys that will be emitted as a `hotkey` event on the view. For usage example see [example]{@tutorial hotkeys}.
Within Platform, OpenFin also implements a set of pre-defined actions called
[keyboard commands]{@link https://developers.openfin.co/docs/platform-api#section-5-3-using-keyboard-commands}
that can be assigned to a specific hotkey in the platform manifest.

items.description: A hotkey binding.

keys.description: The key combination of the hotkey, i.e. "Ctrl+T".

manifestUrl.description:
**Platforms Only.** Url to a manifest that contains View Options. Properties other than manifestUrl can still be used
but the properties in the manifest will take precedence if there is any collision.

preloadScripts.description: Scripts that run before page load.  When omitted, inherits from the parent application.

items.description: A script that is run before page load.

url.description: The URL from which the script was loaded.

processAffinity.description: String tag that attempts to group like-tagged renderers together. Will only be used if pages are on the same origin.

target.description: The identity of the window this view should be attached to.

height.description:
If true, the view's height will grow and shrink together with the window. false
by default.

horizontal.description:
If true, the view's x position and width will grow and shrink proportionally with
the window. false by default.

vertical.description:
If true, the view's y position and height will grow and shrink proportionally with
the window. false by default.

width.description:
If true, the view's width will grow and shrink together with the window. false
by default.

accelerator.description: Enable keyboard shortcuts for devtools, zoom, reload, and reload ignoring cache.

autoplayPolicy.description:
Autoplay policy to apply to content in the window, can be
`no-user-gesture-required`, `user-gesture-required`,
`document-user-activation-required`. Defaults to `no-user-gesture-required`.

backgroundColor.description:
The views _backfill_ color as a hexadecimal value. Not to be confused with the content background color
(`document.body.style.backgroundColor`),
this color briefly fills a views (a) content area before its content is loaded as well as (b) newly exposed
areas when growing a view. Setting
this value to the anticipated content background color can help improve user experience.
Default is white.

contentCreation.description: Configures how new content (e,g, from `window.open` or a link) is opened.

contentNavigation.description:
Restrict navigation to URLs that match a whitelisted pattern.
In the lack of a whitelist, navigation to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

contextMenuOptions.description: Configure the context menu when right-clicking on a window.

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._

customRequestHeaders.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the view.

items.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the window.

headers.description:
Headers for requests sent by window; {key: value} results
in a header of `key=value`.

items.description:
Object representing headers and their values, where the
object key is the name of header and value key is the value of the header

urlPatterns.description: The URL patterns for which the headers will be applied.

hotkeys.description:
Defines the hotkeys that will be emitted as a `hotkey` event on the view. For usage example see [example]{@tutorial hotkeys}.
Within Platform, OpenFin also implements a set of pre-defined actions called
[keyboard commands]{@link https://developers.openfin.co/docs/platform-api#section-5-3-using-keyboard-commands}
that can be assigned to a specific hotkey in the platform manifest.

items.description: A hotkey binding.

keys.description: The key combination of the hotkey, i.e. "Ctrl+T".

manifestUrl.description:
**Platforms Only.** Url to a manifest that contains View Options. Properties other than manifestUrl can still be used
but the properties in the manifest will take precedence if there is any collision.

preloadScripts.description: Scripts that run before page load.  When omitted, inherits from the parent application.

items.description: A script that is run before page load.

url.description: The URL from which the script was loaded.

processAffinity.description: String tag that attempts to group like-tagged renderers together. Will only be used if pages are on the same origin.

__type_26.description: Configuration Object for the show/hide tabs button within the browser toolbar

__type_27.description: Configuration Object for the page lock/unlock button within the browser toolbar

closeButton.description:
Used to manipulate behaviour of a close button on a page tab. If `undefined`, then close button is visible and actionable.
If either property true, this page tab's context menu will disable its 'Close Page' option.

iconUrl.description: Icon that appears on a page tab if there are no unsaved changes. If 'undefined', default icon will appear.

panels.description: Used to configure fixed views on the edges of the browser window. Only one panel per side is supported.

unsavedIconUrl.description: Icon that appears on a page tab if there are unsaved changes (dirty state). If 'undefined', default icon will appear.

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier of the compenent

deviceId.description: The device id of the display.

displayDeviceActive.description: True if the display is active.

deviceId.description: The device id of the display.

displayDeviceActive.description: True if the display is active.

additionalProperties.description: Data passed between entities and applications.

id.description: An object containing string key-value pairs for the bulk of the data for the context. Differs between context types.

name.description: User-readable name for the incoming context.

type.description: Conserved type for the context (e.g. `instrument` or `country`).

arguments.description: The arguments to pass to the application.

path.description: The file path to where the running application resides.

__type_4.description: Configures how new content (e,g, from `window.open` or a link) is opened.

rules.description: List of rules for creation of new content.

items.description:
A rule for creating content in OpenFin; maps a content type to the way in which
newly-opened content of that type will be handled.

args.description: The default command line arguments for the aforementioned target.

mandatory.description:
When set to true, the app will fail to load if the asset cannot be downloaded.
When set to false, the app will continue to load if the asset cannot be downloaded. (Default: true)

src.description: The URL to a zip file containing the package files (executables, dlls, etc)

target.description: Specify default executable to launch. This option can be overridden in launchExternalProcess

accelerator.description: Enable keyboard shortcuts for devtools, zoom, reload, and reload ignoring cache.

alphaMask.description:
Turns anything of matching RGB value transparent.

Caveats:
* runtime key --disable-gpu is required. Note: Unclear behavior on remote Desktop support
* User cannot click-through transparent regions
* Not supported on Mac
* Windows Aero must be enabled
* Won't make visual sense on Pixel-pushed environments such as Citrix
* Not supported on rounded corner windows

autoShow.description: Automatically show the window when it is created.

autoplayPolicy.description:
Autoplay policy to apply to content in the window, can be
`no-user-gesture-required`, `user-gesture-required`,
`document-user-activation-required`. Defaults to `no-user-gesture-required`.

backgroundColor.description:
The windows _backfill_ color as a hexadecimal value. Not to be confused with the content background color
(`document.body.style.backgroundColor`),
this color briefly fills a windows (a) content area before its content is loaded as well as (b) newly exposed
areas when growing a window. Setting
this value to the anticipated content background color can help improve user experience.
Default is white.

contentCreation.description: Configures how new content (e,g, from `window.open` or a link) is opened.

contentNavigation.description:
Restrict navigation to URLs that match a whitelisted pattern.
In the lack of a whitelist, navigation to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

contentRedirect.description:
Restrict redirects to URLs that match a whitelisted pattern.
In the lack of a whitelist, redirects to URLs that match a blacklisted pattern would be prohibited.
See [here](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns) for more details.

contextMenuOptions.description: Configure the context menu when right-clicking on a window.

cornerRounding.description:
Defines and applies rounded corners for a frameless window. **NOTE:** On macOS corner is not ellipse but circle rounded by the
 average of _height_ and _width_.

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._

customRequestHeaders.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the window.

items.description: Custom headers for requests sent by the window.

headers.description:
Headers for requests sent by window; {key: value} results
in a header of `key=value`.

items.description:
Object representing headers and their values, where the
object key is the name of header and value key is the value of the header

urlPatterns.description: The URL patterns for which the headers will be applied.

defaultCentered.description:
Centers the window in the primary monitor. This option overrides `defaultLeft` and `defaultTop`. When `saveWindowState` is `true`,
this value will be ignored for subsequent launches in favor of the cached value. **NOTE:** On macOS _defaultCenter_ is
somewhat above center vertically.

hotkeys.description:
Defines the hotkeys that will be emitted as a `hotkey` event on the window. For usage example see [example]{@tutorial hotkeys}.
Within Platform, OpenFin also implements a set of pre-defined actions called
[keyboard commands]{@link https://developers.openfin.co/docs/platform-api#section-5-3-using-keyboard-commands}
that can be assigned to a specific hotkey in the platform manifest.

items.description: A hotkey binding.

keys.description: The key combination of the hotkey, i.e. "Ctrl+T".

icon.description:
A URL for the icon to be shown in the window title bar and the taskbar.
When omitted, inherits from the parent application._
 note: Window OS caches taskbar icons, therefore an icon change might only be visible after the cache is removed or the uuid is changed.

ignoreSavedWindowState.description:
Ignores the cached state of the window.
Defaults the opposite value of `saveWindowState` to maintain backwards compatibility.

modalParentIdentity.description: Parent identity of a modal window. It will create a modal child window when this option is set.

preloadScripts.description: Scripts that run before page load.  When omitted, inherits from the parent application.

items.description: A script that is run before page load.

url.description: The URL from which the script was loaded.

processAffinity.description: String tag that attempts to group like-tagged renderers together. Will only be used if pages are on the same origin.

resizeRegion.description: Defines a region in pixels that will respond to user mouse interaction for resizing a frameless window.

taskbarIconGroup.description:
Specify a taskbar group for the window.
_If omitted, defaults to app's uuid (`fin.Application.getCurrentSync().identity.uuid`)._

viewVisibility.description: _Platform Windows Only_. Controls behavior for showing views when they are being resized by the user.

devtools.description: Should the context menu contain a button for opening devtools.

enable.description: Should the context menu display on right click.

reload.description: Should the context menu contain a button for reloading the page.

__type_8.description: Configure the context menu when right-clicking on a window.

enabled.description: Displays the context menu on right click.

template.description: Context menu items to display on right-click.
